body:
18446744073709551615 = 0xffffffffffffffff = 2**64-1

So changing the type to `uint64` would fix it. However  I think there is probably more to the solution than that...

What do you think @ivandeex ?

@dmak

This constant looks like "-1" represented as a big unsigned int.
I have not seen this value from mail.ru yet, cannot tell for sure what it means.
This could mark something special about the file (wrong/recent/old/up-to-date/image etc)

As I can't reproduce your situation, let's investigate together using your files.
I have built a special rclone right for you, which will not fail but report files with strange time.
You can download it here: https://github.com/ivandeex/rclone/releases/tag/v1.51.timetest

Please run it like this
```
C:\path\to\timetest\rclone-windows-4.0-amd64.exe lsl mailru:
```
notice file(s) reported like this:
```
ERROR: Invalid time 18446744073709551615 for file "/path/to/strange/file"
```
and report it here. We can later decide how to treat such files.

Please don't run `rclone sync` against your mailru files before we find out what this time means.

I see the same error in the output:
```
2020/05/18 02:45:06 ERROR : []: Invalid time 18446744073709551615 for file "Photos/2015/20150718_154544.jpg"
```

In this test build of rclone this "Error" message is in not an actual error but rather a warning. Rclone accepted invalid modification time returned by mail.ru and internally replaced it by "1970-01-01 00:00:00". I warned you against syncing because the file is treated as "very old" and could be overwritten by sync.

Now I ask you look again at `20150718_154544.jpg` and reason: when did you upload this file to mail.ru? Is it old or up-to-date?
By the way, if you have access to https://cloud.mail.ru, please find there the file and tell me what modification time is shown?

I have found out that locally this file also has timestamp 1 Jan 1970 and in the cloud it appears without date:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/366965/82194138-a07aca80-98f6-11ea-97c2-7a148795c5c8.png)
The file was corrupted as well as timestamp was lost probably when this file was copied from one drive to another. Interestingly, online displaying also has some bugs when I click on History:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/366965/82194911-d8364200-98f7-11ea-9ab1-a2f6d24cc683.png)
Thank you for input. I am going to have a fix merged soon.

issue.title: mailru: fix invalid timestamp on corrupted files (fixes #4229)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

An rclone user encountered an old corrupted file that resulted in an invalid modifcation timestamp
returned by mail.ru server as a large unsigned integer bitwise representing int64 "-1".
Currently mail.ru backend keeps server timestamps as signed int64 and the above number results
in panic during json unmarshaling.
This issue is rare and cannot be easily reproduced in a test.

This fix makes mail.ru backend catch invalid timestamps and replace them by Unix epoch "1970-01-01-...".
The reporter confirmed that this change fixes issue for them
(see https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4229#issuecomment-630050995).

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes, in the bug report https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4229

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate (**no, confirmed by user**)
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate (**no, bugfixes need no docs**)
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
The issue is sort of back in v1.60.0:
```
panic: Invalid UInt64 -1                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                            
goroutine 73 [running]:                                                                                                                     
github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru/api.(*BinWriter).WritePu64(0xc0006b97e8?, 0xc000d373b0?)
        github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru/api/helpers.go:67 +0xe8
github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru.(*Object).addFileMetaData(0xc0013c6420, {0x2334130?, 0xc000cf1280}, 0x1)
        github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru/mailru.go:2061 +0x33c
github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru.(*Object).Update(0xc0013c6420, {0x2334130, 0xc000cf1280}, {0x231f2a0, 0xc00238c600}, {0x7f7538811318, 0xc0011d3ec0}, {0xc002166b90, 0x1, 0x1})
        github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru/mailru.go:1737 +0xf26
github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru.(*Fs).Put(0xc0005c31e0, {0x2334130, 0xc000cf1280}, {0x231f2a0, 0xc00238c600}, {0x7f7538811318?, 0xc0011d3ec0?}, {0xc002166b90, 0x1, 0x1})
        github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru/mailru.go:1598 +0x1d6
github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/operations.Copy({0x2334130, 0xc000cf1280}, {0x2345f40, 0xc0005c31e0}, {0x0?, 0x0?}, {0xc000ea0270, 0x2c}, {0x2345ed0, 0xc0011d3ec0})
        github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/operations/operations.go:501 +0x1b6e
github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync.(*syncCopyMove).pairCopyOrMove(0xc0008c98c0, {0x2334130, 0xc000cf1280}, 0x0?, {0x2345f40, 0xc0005c31e0}, 0x0?, 0x0?)
        github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync/sync.go:423 +0x1bb
created by github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync.(*syncCopyMove).startTransfers
        github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync/sync.go:450 +0x45
```
Should I report it as a new issue?
@dmak - please make a new issue and a way I can reproduce it if at all possible - thanks.

issue.title: MailRu synchronization fails with "panic: Invalid UInt64 -1" in addFileMetaData()

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I am using rclone v1.60.0 in Linux x64. When running synchronization with mailru cloud the following error occurs:
```
$ rclone sync -vvv --dump headers,bodies --track-renames ~/cloud mailru:

2022/11/07 15:09:47 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc000247f00)

Host: cld-uploader8.cloud.mail.ru
User-Agent: rclone/v1.60.0
Content-Length: 1970770
Accept: */*
Accept-Encoding: gzip
...
2022/11/07 15:09:47 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2022/11/07 15:09:48 DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<

github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru.(*Object).Update(0xc0013c6420, {0x2334130, 0xc000cf1280}, {0x231f2a0, 0xc00238c600}, {0x7f7538811318, 0xc0011d3ec0}, {0xc002166b90, 0x1, 0x1})

github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/mailru.(*Fs).Put(0xc0005c31e0, {0x2334130, 0xc000cf1280}, {0x231f2a0, 0xc00238c600}, {0x7f7538811318?, 0xc0011d3ec0?}, {0xc002166b90, 0x1, 0x1})

        github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/operations/operations.go:501 +0x1b6e
github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync.(*syncCopyMove).pairCopyOrMove(0xc0008c98c0, {0x2334130, 0xc000cf1280}, 0x0?, {0x2345f40, 0xc0005c31e0}, 0x0?, 0x0?)
```
